column1: Little Goat Diner////After a disheartening flight to Chicago
column2: a desire to eat my feelings led to Randolph St. It was very late
column3: but Au Cheval still had an hour wait
column4: so we ventured into Little Goat. Our sleepy host promptly guided us to a table near the back of the restaurant where I had a good view of the kitchen staff
column5: all of whom were wearing either bandannas or hats. No worries of sweaty food here. The menu is in a true diner style with a laminated triptych. I was mainly interested in the breakfast section
column7: and decided to order Biscuits and Gravy along with French Toast.
